main event: A U.S. Navy P2V aircraft pilot reported an unidentified aerial object described as round and white, approximately 50 feet in diameter, observed in the vicinity on 8 November 1964.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 20,000 feet and maintained a steady course for about 10 minutes before disappearing., The object did not appear to be a conventional aircraft, balloon, or any known object., It made no sound and emitted no exhaust or visible means of propulsion., The sighting was confirmed by all four crew members of the aircraft., Weather conditions during the observation were clear with unlimited visibility.
witness description: crew members of a U.S. Navy P2V aircraft
